subject: RE: [junit] source code management
msgSnippet: Just curious how you got this gig?  It seems odd to me that you would not know about cvs, and that you haven t been able to get JUnit working with your test
messageBody:
Just curious how you got this gig? It seems odd to me that you would not
know about cvs, and that you haven't been able to get JUnit working with
your test cases (previous email), yet you have a gig teaching a course on it
in the spring. I'm not just being facetious; I'm seriously curious what the
situation was.

Scott Stirling

-----Original Message-----
From: Rick Denman
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 12/30/01 9:01 PM
Subject: [junit] source code management


I am teaching a course in extreme programming in the spring, and I would
like to know if there is a university friendly (i.e. free) source code
management tool that works well with JUnit and the IDE Kawa. I plan to
have
several pairs of programmers working on the same project, and of course
want to require frequent code integration.

Thanks,

Rick Denman
Southwestern University
